description: From be- (prefix meaning ‘about; around’) +‎ spawl (“to scatter spittle from the mouth, spit”).

verbs.description: bespawl (third-person singular simple present bespawls, present participle bespawling, simple past and past participle bespawled)

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete) To daub, make foul, or soil (someone or something) with spawl or spittle.
